alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 24 at 2:45AM MST until November 24 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 14 inches in northern Carbon County, and 3 to 7 inches in Central Carbon County and the North Snowy Range Foothills. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph may produce near blizzard conditions at times. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, Central Carbon County and North Snowy Range Foothills. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact post-holiday travel. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills
